node.html: A hackathon is a sprint-like event where innovators and inventors, usually students, can come together to solve real-world challenges using technology.
Anything! We encourage any and all forms of solutions: whether it’s a game, app, hardware, AR, or anything at all.
No worries, please e-mail us at sheridanhackville@gmail.com and we will be more than happy to answer your question!

frontmatter.title: My question isn’t here, who can I contact?

node.html: Yes! We require all hackers to abide by the the MLH code of conduct.

frontmatter.title: Is there a code of conduct?

node.html: Yes! As a beginner-friendly hackathon, we will set you up with the knowledge you need to start your first hackathon project, along with mentors.

frontmatter.title: I don’t know any coding. Can I still compete?

node.html: Hackville is completely free! We aim to make our event as accessible as possible, regardless of financial ability.

We are allowing team sizes of up to 4 people on a team. You can come with a team, though we highly encourage creating your team at the event! At the very beginning of the hackathon we will hold a team building session for anybody who does not have a team at that time.

Since our event is virtual, you'll have easy access to your laptop, pens, paper and any other tools you may need to hack. We will provide a safe, collaborative environment for all participants — and swag!

frontmatter.title: Do I need to bring anything?

node.html: No, you will be disqualified if a submitted project was worked on prior to the hackathon weekend. All coding and design work must be done during the hackathon weekend.

frontmatter.title: Can I start working on my hack before the hackathon?
